channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Calls for JustGiving to hand back £308,000 fee from Colonel Tom Moore's £32m NHS walk
item.description: The crowdfunding website took one per cent from Gift Aid donations made to the veteran's fundraiser after he walked 100 laps of his Bedfordshire garden - amounting to a staggering £308,683.

item.title: Coronavirus CAN be found in semen, study shows
item.description: Researchers in China looked at semen samples of 38 men who had tested positive for COVID-19. One in six had traces of the virus in their semen - including some who were no longer sick.

item.title: NYC nurse steals credit card from dying coronavirus patient and uses it to buy groceries and gas
item.description: New York nurse Danielle Conti, 43, was arrested Thursday for stealing the credit card of a dying coronavirus patient Anthony Catapano, 70, to buy $60-worth of groceries and gas.

item.title: That was super, moon: Sky watchers are transfixed as 'Flower moon' rises putting on stunning display
item.description: The Flower Moon lit up the sky as the last supermoon of 2020 was seen at its most impressive at around 8.45pm. It appeared around six per cent larger than a typical full moon.

item.title: Code breakers intercepted the very final German message sent during WWII
item.description: GCHQ historian Tony Comer said: 'These transcripts give us a small insight into the real people behind the machinery of war.

item.title: Two hundred MILLION pieces of PPE in the UK's stockpile were 'out of date' when coronavirus hit
item.description: Millions of pieces of vital personal protective equipment in the UK's national pandemic stockpile were out of date when the coronavirus hit, an investigation has revealed.

item.title: Moment ex-cop, 64, and son, 34, are arrested for the MURDER of unarmed black jogger Ahmaud Arbery
item.description: Exclusive photos show the moment Gregory McMichael, 64, and Travis McMichael, 34, were arrested at their home in Brunswick, Georgia, on Thursday.

item.title: Coronavirus crisis separates Owen Howkins from his best friend, Haatchi the Anatolian Shepherd dog
item.description: When three-legged Anatolian Shepherd Haatchi first entered Owen Howkins' home he would slide about recklessly, but, the moment he stepped into Owen's bedroom his demeanour changed completely.

item.title: Kyle Walker opens up on his mental health anguish after breaking lockdown rules
item.description: The Sun reported that the 29-year-old had flouted Government guidelines just weeks after he apologised for holding a sex party with two escorts. Walker released a statement on social media.

item.title: EU 'bowed to pressure from Beijing to censor letter saying coronavirus originated in China'
item.description: The European Union has excised reference in a public letter that the coronavirus pandemic originated in China, after receiving pressure to do so from the Chinese foreign ministry.

item.title: Kate Garraway joins the nation in clapping for carers amid lockdown
item.description: The TV presenter, 53, joined millions of people around the country in a nationwide applause for the NHS, police and key workers during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Norway lifts lockdown with schools opening on Monday
item.description: In a roadmap to lockdown being lifted in Norway, Prime Minister Erna Solberg said today bars will be open from 1 June with cultural and sporting events of up to 200 people permitted from 15 June.

item.title: Joe Biden's sex accuser now says he made 'vulgar' comment to her during alleged assault
item.description: Tara Reade, the woman who's accused Joe Biden of sexual assault, sat down with Megyn Kelly for her first major on-camera interview and included new details about the alleged incident.

item.title: TOM UTLEY: The day I stabbed myself with a chandelier and why I won't miss foreign holidays one jot
item.description: TOM UTLEY: I'm quite content to stay here in my South London suburb -with perhaps a trip to Norfolk, Scotland or Wales when the lockdown eases.

item.title: JAN MOIR: From the boffin Neil Ferguson to Boris Johnson, sex still makes fools of clever men
item.description: JAN MOIR: We are supposed to be sophisticated people, living in a time of enlightenment. Look at us. We paint pictures, play the piano and ice our cakes with star-shaped nozzles.

item.title: Great British Bake Off winner Frances Quinnbanned from Waitrose after being accused of shoplifting
item.description: Quinn, 38, was stopped by store officials in her home town Market Harborough, Leicestershire, for not paying for items including flour and eggs.

item.title: VE Day minute-by-minute: How Britons will commemorate the end of the Second World War
item.description: The British public from Scotland to Wales and Derby may be confined to their homes today, on the 75th anniversary of VE Day; but the national crisis is not deterring them from marking the occasion.

item.title: Trains will return to running at 70% of normal timetable in 10 days
item.description: Ministers and industry chiefs are urgently working to beef up capacity by May 18 to around two-thirds of the full UK railway timetable.

item.title: Lockdown could last into JUNE with Boris Johnson's Sunday relaxation of restrictions to be small
item.description: The Prime Minister told the cabinet he will proceed with 'maximum caution' when it comes to easing restrictions, to avoid another rise in coronavirus cases in the UK.

item.title: Police fear becoming 'the villains of the pandemic' by enforcing rules
item.description: Police have privately criticised the government for discussing lifting Covid-19 restrictions ahead of a bank holiday weekend where the lockdown remains in place.

item.title: Baby bust: Coronavirus lockdown is putting people OFF having children
item.description: Research led by the University of Florence found over 80 per cent of people do not plan to conceive during the COVID-19 crisis.

item.title: Fury as leaked report says Government warned over 'insufficient' pandemic plans three YEARS ago
item.description: Experts warned in 2017 that demand for services would outstrip capacity and outlined the problems facing care homes in the face of a highly contagious disease outbreak.

item.title: Adele's trainer says weight loss was never about getting super skinny
item.description: The singer, 32, who has been sticking to a 1,000-a-day calorie diet, showed off her incredible seven stone weight loss in a tight black minidress in a rare Instagram snap on Tuesday.

item.title: Adele's trainer says weight loss was never about getting super skinny
item.description: The singer, 32, who has been sticking to a 1,000-a-day calorie diet, showed off her incredible seven stone weight loss in a tight black minidress in a rare Instagram snap on Tuesday.

item.title: Warren Jeffs accuser opens up on life in the polygamist cult
item.description: Rebecca Musser, 44, is opening up on life in the polygamist cult run by church leader Warren Jeffs, 64, in Utah and how she helped bring him down.

item.title: Microsoft unveils Xbox Series X gameplay and new 'badge' for when games run best on the console
item.description: In a live-streamed event on Thursday the gaming titan showcased in-engine gameplay of several upcoming titles for the Series X, Microsoft's upcoming next-generation console.

item.title: Zoom buys security service in bid to address safety concerns and introduce end-to-end encryption
item.description: Keybase will help the Zoom build end-to-end encryption designed to safeguard user data and privacy and bolster its current security measures which it incorrectly claimed included full encryption.

item.title: VE Day 75 years on: Timetable to make the most of the day
item.description: DAVID WILKES: The parades have been ­cancelled but even in lockdown nothing can quell the nation's spirit when it comes to celebrating today's 75th anniversary of VE Day.

item.title: How much will remdesivir cost? Experts say even $10 may be too much for Gilead's antiviral
item.description: A report from a cost watchdog estimated that it costs $9.32 to manufacture one 10-day course of remdesivir treatment and that, if proven to save live, it could cost $4,500 per treatment.

item.title: Inside the Alpine hotel where the King of Thailand is spending lockdown
item.description: King Maha Vajiralongkorn, 67, is believed to be back at the four-star retreat in southern Germany (pictured) after returning from brief visits back to Thailand.

item.title: Keir Starmer says VE Day generation must be protected from coronavirus in care homes
item.description: In an article saluting veterans on the 75th anniversary of VE Day, Keir Starmer said the care sector needs attention after the pandemic to help those who 'protected our country in its darkest hour'.

item.title: Rapper Ty dies aged 47 after contracting coronavirus
item.description: The rapper's death was confirmed by his team on Thursday after he was hospitalised and placed in a medically-induced coma following 'complications' surrounding the virus.

item.title: Simpson show writers predicted COVID-19 and killer insects taking over in 2020
item.description: A Tuesday tweet featuring a clip of the 1993 episode of the hit show was retweeted by show writer Bill Oakley. 'Ok fine, I guess we did,' he said on the tweet, which was liked more than 51,000 times.

item.title: Elon Musk tells Joe Rogan's podcast girlfriend Grimes was behind their son's unusual name
item.description: Musk shared a photo of the newborn, telling fans the baby is called X Æ A-12, inset. In a two hour long chat released Thursday the billionaire broke down the name, main.

item.title: Anna Nicole Smith's ex-boyfriend is shot dead in South Carolina after jail on no trespass charge
item.description: Mark Hatten, was killed in Greelyville, South Carolina on Sunday afternoon and the day before he had been in an altercation before police arrested him on a no trespass charge.

item.title: Cancer-stricken girl, 4, breaks down in tears as she is finally reunited with dad in touching clip
item.description: Mila Sneddon, from Falkirk, Scotland, stole the hearts of the nation when she was seen kissing her father Scott, 50, through a glass window at the start of the UK's lockdown.

item.title: Mugger, 40, who fled when retired bus driver, 77, fought back is jailed for three-and-a-half years
item.description: Michael Collins, 40, attempted to mug Trevor Weston as he withdrew money for his morning papers in Roath, Cardiff, on February 5. Collins has now been jailed for three and a half years.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell 'not convinced' Jeffrey Epstein killed himself
item.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is 'not convinced' her former lover, billionaire paedophile Jeffrey Epstein, killed himself in his New York prison cell, a source close to the socialite has said.

item.title: Boris Johnson praises WWII veterans in letter to mark VE Day during the coronavirus crisis
item.description: The Prime Minister has thanked veterans whose efforts to defeat a 'ruthless enemy' in Nazism and Fascism during the world war would 'always be remembered' on the 75th anniversary of VE Day.

item.title: NHSX Covid-19 contact tracing app doesn't work on two-year-old phones
item.description: Residents on the Isle of Wight today claim they are unable to use the new NHS contact tracing app on phones which are more than two years old.

item.title: BAME NHS workers on Covid-19 frontline should ask ask to be moved says Dame Donna Kinnair
item.description: BAME staff working on the front lines of the NHS should ask to move if they feel endangered, the chief executive of the Royal College of Nursing has said. It comes after a popular pharmacist died last month.

item.title: Coronavirus crisis means tonnes of British cheese is being thrown away
item.description: GUY ADAMS: we produce more varieties of cheese even than the French. Sadly, these high-quality cheeses are extremely difficult to shift with the h­ospitality sector closed.

item.title: Benidorm says British holidaymakers won't have to sunbathe inside plexiglass booths
item.description: Clear plexiglass booths similar to office cubicles will not be used on Benidorm's beaches as they would create 'unbearable temperatures,' the resort's mayor has said. It comes as beaches prepare to reopen.

item.title: Another study finds hydroxchloroquine offers NO benefit for coronavirus patients
item.description: A new Columbia University study found that 811 coronavirus patients given hydroxychloroquine were just as likely to need ventilators or die as were 566 patients who did not get the malaria drug.
item.media:description: FILE - This Monday, April 6, 2020 file photo shows an arrangement of hydroxychloroquine tablets in Las Vegas. According to results released on Thursday, May 7, 2020, a new study finds no evidence of benefit from a malaria drug widely promoted as a treatment for coronavirus infection. Hydroxychloroquine did not lower the risk of dying or needing a breathing tube in a comparison that involved nearly 1,400 consecutive patients treated at Columbia University Irving Medical Center in New York. (AP Photo/John Locher)

item.title: Fury as Sir Keir Starmer asks 'have you got what you need' when applauding the NHS
item.description: New Labour leader Keir Starmer sparked a row on Twitter after asking the media 'have you got everything you need' at the end of the 8pm 'clap for our carers'.

item.title: Millions of Britons mark seventh weekly 'Clap for Carers' event
item.description: Clap for Carers is now in its seventh week, with Britons up and down the country stepping onto their doorsteps, balconies and front gardens to applaud frontline workers at 8pm tonight.

item.title: Rare Harry Potter books salvaged from a SKIP
item.description: The three copies of Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone could sell for between £2,000 and £12,000 when they go under the hammer in Staffordshire on May 21.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll with 30,615 with 539 new fatalities
item.description: Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab tonight described the growing number of COVID-19 fatalities as 'tragic'. He revealed 5,600 more Britons had tested positive for the deadly virus.

item.title: 400,000 people in Britain have caught coronavirus
item.description: As many as 400,000 people in Britain have caught the coronavirus and 20,000 citizens are being infected each day, experts claimed today.

item.title: White red squirrel spotted enjoying a spot of breakfast
item.description: A rare white red squirrel has been spotted having breakfast in a garden in Perthshire. Chris Eddington photographed the rare mammal in at his home in Dunkeld and told a Scottish squirrel monitoring group.

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: What, more cycle lanes? On yer bike!
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Let's hear it for White Van Man. And Black Van Man, and every other shade of van man and woman. Where the hell would we have been without them over the past few weeks?

item.title: NINE Chelsea pensioners die of coronavirus
item.description: Among the Chelsea Pensioners who lost their lives to the virus was Fred Boomer-Hawkins, 75, who became ill in the last week of March. Nine Chelsea Pensioners have been killed by the disease.

item.title: Winston Churchill salutes as King cheers Allied triumph: How last days of WWII were reported in 1945
item.description: Winston Churchill stood on a balcony and addressed a vast and cheering crowd in Whitehall in London, giving the V sign as he told them it was the victory of 'the great British nation as a whole'.

item.title: Government urged to slash 'too generous' furlough payments to some workers to kick-start economy
item.description: IFS chief Paul Johnson acknowledged there was an 'incredibly difficult and fine judgment' to be made as some sectors of the economy were unlikely to ever fully recover but others could be restarted.

item.title: Mysterious underwater insect uses microplastics to build protective microshelters for itself
item.description: As microplastics continue to fill the world's oceans and rivers, one mysterious yet resourceful insect is using the pollutants to build shelters for itself, though the shells aren't as strong as natural ones.

item.title: Captain Tom recalls fighting on the front lines in Burma in WWII and memories of VE Day
item.description: The former British Army Officer from Yorkshire fought on a motorbike and survived giant spiders and dengue fever during the Allied campaign in Burma, the 'Forgotten War' against Imperial Japan in 1942-45.

item.title: US Military reveals mission details of X-37B space plane for the first time ahead of orbital flight
item.description: The US Air Force's secretive X-37B space plane will conduct three experiments in low orbit, including converting the sun's power into radio frequency microwave energy.

item.title: Richard Branson's sister Vanessa reveals why she took 'cruel, cheating husband' back
item.description: In her devastatingly frank memoir, Vanessa Branson reveals how she later had a boob job, took a lover and, astonishingly, tried to make her marriage work again in order to get her life back on track.

item.title: Japanese honeybees COOK invading 'murder hornets' to death
item.description: Murderous Asian hornets are invading honeybee hives- decapitating the insects and feeding the bodies to their young. But Japanese bees are fighting back by cooking the predators to death.

item.title: Yet ANOTHER Priti Patel pledge on migrant crossings
item.description: Home Secretary Priti Patel, pictured, has vowed to send boats packed with migrants seeking to land in Britain back to France and fund more patrols near the French coastline.

item.title: How Rishi Sunak's Yorkshire idyll went from Richmond to poorer
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak once spoke about the closure of a local pub in his Richmond constituency in North Yorkshire and his regret over the loss. Now one third of his constituents face the dole.

item.title: Global warming could trigger ancient Indian Ocean El Niño-like climate pattern by 2100
item.description: Computer simulations reveal climate change could awaken an ancient Indian Ocean El Niño by 2100, but the phenomenon could occur as early as 2050 if the current warming trends continue.

item.title: The £900,000 cheques really ARE in the post as 17,000 donate to Mail Force drive for PPE
item.description: An incredible 37,000 Daily Mail readers have donated £1.6million to supply protective kit for frontline NHS and care staff. Total expected to pass £2million as 4,000 letters are still to be opened.
item.media:credit: Jamie Wiseman for The Daily Mail

item.title: Facebook's 'supreme court' who decide what can be posted
item.description: Facebook has been accused of a being a 'Left-wing enclave' after it revealed members of the panel; Former Guardian editor Alan Rusbridger and ex-Danish social democrat Helle Thorning-Schmidt.

item.title: Tinder testing out a new video feature that aims to match users via a live-streamed game of trivia
item.description: While the details of how the game will work are sparse, picture from The Verge suggest that it will be live and may even include a chat feature in which a 'live audience' can watch along.

item.title: Brazen gang steal items worth millions from homes of Frank Lampard and late Leicester City owner
item.description: The gang stole more than £1million from the late Leicester owner's house in Knightsbridge, west London, which has been left as a shrine since his death in a helicopter crash in October 2018.

item.title: Arthritis drug may improve coronavirus patients - but experts warn effects are far from proven
item.description: A new study from San Raffaele Hospital in Milan, Italy, found that 72% of 29 coronavirus patients given anakinra, an arthritis drug, had improved respiratory health and markers of inflammation.

item.title: People who recover from coronavirus could provide 'shield immunity,' study says
item.description: Scientists say these people would need to be identified through antibody tests and could help in the development of `shield immunity' by returning to work while more at-risk people stay home.

item.title: Elon Musk says Neuralink will do brain implants 'within a year'
item.description: Speaking on Joe Rogan's podcast, Elon Musk said Neuralink will have a version of brain implant ready 'within a year', which aims to treat brain injuries and trauma, and enable symbiosis with AI.

item.title: Baby born at 22 weeks weighing just 1lb back home after fighting series of illnesses
item.description: When she was born four months early and weighing the same as a small bag of sugar, doctors warned Lilly Menear's parents to prepare for the worst.

item.title: Second US ex-Special Forces soldier Airan Berry, 41, is paraded on Venezuelan TV
item.description: Airan Berry, 41, who was arrested in Venezuela Monday for his role in an failed coup on President Nicolás Maduro was shown in video clips Thursday being interrogated about his role.

item.title: Elite school embroiled in child sex allegations - board member charged over 'abhorrent' videos
item.description: Perth Modern School's Craig Andrew Donovan, 56, has been charged after officers allegedly uncovered child abuse videos on his mobile phone and desktop computer.

item.title: RUTH SUNDERLAND: Yes, a slump is coming... but we can bounce back
item.description: RUTH SUNDERLAND: Bank of England governor Andrew Bailey has injected a very welcome dose of hope into an atmosphere of almost unrelenting despair since replacing Mark Carney.

item.title: Dallas salon owner who refused to close her store during the pandemic WALKS FREE from prison
item.description: Shelley Luther, the owner of Salon a la Mode in Dallas who repeatedly defied Texas's stay-at-home order, walked out of jail Thursday after the Supreme Court intervened and ordered her release.

item.title: Prince Andrew and Sarah Ferguson are sued over £5m unpaid bill
item.description: Legal proceedings have been launched in Switzerland against Britain's Prince Andrew and ex-wife Sarah, a newspaper said today, over money they were said to still owe on their chalet.

item.title: Liverpool gran, 60, wears full hazmat suit to see her grandson, six during coronavirus pandemic
item.description: A determined Liverpool grandmother donned a full hazmat suit so she could go and see her grandson. Sheila Abbott, 60, paid a surprise visit to her family, including Mason, six, wearing full protective gear.

item.title: Life on the ocean wave was a floating HELL!
item.description: Stephen Taylor examines the 'heroic age of sail' in a fascinating new book. The British author reveals how more sailors died from fever and accidents, than in war.

item.title: I just wish Hitler could hear the cheering! That was one little girl's take on VE Day
item.description: Maureen Waller's detailed portrait of London in 1945, has been reissued in paperback to commemorate this year's anniversary of VE Day.

item.title: Shocking moment a praying mantis kills and eats the head of a 'murder hornet'
item.description: A praying mantis attacked and ate the head of what appeared to be an Asian giant hornet, or 'murder hornet' in a video circulating

item.title: Mystery of WWII landing craft tank that vanished in 1943 is solved
item.description: LCT 326 was part of a flotilla heading from Troon, Scotland to Appledore in Devon when it was lost in heavy seas off the Welsh coast. The vessel was commanded by Temp Sub Lieutenant W Griffiths.

item.title: Boris Johnson's Covid-19 lockdown exit plan explained in full
item.description: The proposals are to be split into five stages over the coming months, and a leaked version of the plan has suggested the first changes on Monday will see unlimited exercise allowed.

item.title: Instagram glitch lets iOS users post unusually long photos that create 'endless' scrolling
item.description: Once posted, the towering images - instead of being cropped portrait-style to fit the app's interface - require users to scroll for an inordinate amount of time in order to see the next image in one's feed.

item.title: Direct cremations take over traditional send-offs amid coronavirus crisis
item.description: Dan Garrett, 30, of London, who founded Farewell, a UK will writing and death specialist, told FEMAIL direct cremations are 'here to stay' and will surpass traditions dating back 'hundreds of years'.

item.title: Meghan and Harry are living in Tyler Perry's $18 million hilltop mansion in Beverly Hills
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle have been staying in an ultra-luxury Beverly Hills hideout that belongs to Hollywood tycoon Tyler Perry, DailyMail.com can reveal.

item.title: Author is accused of racism over comments about Meghan Markle
item.description: Emily Giffin, 48, the author of the 2005 international bestseller Something Borrowed, made the comments on her Instagram account on Wednesday.

item.title: TikTok video shows what celebrities would look like if their faces were perfectly symmetrical
item.description: Dr. Dustin Portela, an Idaho dermatologist, shared a TikTok video in which he showed what stars would look like if their faces had perfect symmetry.

item.title: Celebs are keeping their physique in top form while hunkering down in lavish home gyms
item.description: Fitness-obsessed celebrities have been forced adapt as gyms have closed during the coronavirus loackdown.

item.title: The European flag quiz that only 10% of Britons could score full marks on
item.description: The fastest time that the quiz has been completed in is 1 minute 36 seconds, while the average is 2 minutes 12 seconds. Over two out of three people couldn't identify the flag for Belgium... see if you can.

item.title: Speeded-up LNER cab ride footage of a train travelling from Edinburgh to London in SIX MINUTES
item.description: For those missing travelling around Britain - here's a way to see hundreds of miles of it in mere minutes. LNER has released speeded-up footage of a journey from Edinburgh to Kings Cross.

item.title: Coronavirus: Study suggests staying at home had little effect
item.description: The University of East Anglia team say relaxing stay-at-home orders and letting some businesses reopen could be the UK's first step to easing lockdown.

item.title: Unrepentant Nigel Farage breaks lockdown to watch migrants arriving at Dover
item.description: Mr Farage delivered a letter to Kent Police headquarters in Maidstone in which he said he was 'certain' the visit to his home was 'a very unwise use of officers' time and of public money'.

item.title: A third of Britons say they will travel more than ever once coronavirus restrictions are lifted
item.description: However, 25 per cent of those questioned in the UK poll said they would be more cautious when travelling in the future with 23 per cent adding they would take more domestic trips.

item.title: Counter-terrorism sniffer dogs Mick and Mack are trained to root out destructive Japanese knotweed
item.description: Labrador retrievers Mack and Mick are thought to be the first dogs in the UK trained to sniff out Japanese knotweed in both homes and gardens and will freeze when they identify the plant.

item.title: Middle-aged people are suffering almost 20 per cent more stress than two decades ago, study shows
item.description: The root of the problem lies in the 'generational squeeze' of having dependent parents on one side and grown-up children struggling to start a career on the other, US researchers found.

item.title: Former Goldman Sachs COO's daughter, 28, in court charged with attacking him at £2.6m mansion
item.description: Saskia Pot, 28, hit her father Wiet Pot, who has an estimated net worth of one billion euros, at her £2.6million home in Richmond, London. Her mother, a psychiatrist, said she was 'scared' of her.

item.title: Thieves steal 80,000 protective facemasks intended for NHS and care home workers
item.description: Greater Manchester Police said they are hunting for the perpetrators , in what they described as a 'particularly sickening crime' given the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Mob of officers descend on park to fine youths who tormented lone PCSO
item.description: The brazen moment a PCSO's bike was taken as he tried to disperse the mob in Slough was captured on video. Further footage shows officers flocking to the scene to fine the youths.

item.title: Kitten lures playful dog into pet pen and shuts him in before slipping out between the rails
item.description: Cheeto the kitten outsmarted an English Mastiff Larry after Larry wanted to play but Cheeto was not in a playful mood. Cheeto locked him in a pet pen at their home in Fort Worth, Texas.

item.title: Big nap and fries: Adorable moment toddler struggles to stay awake as he eats his dinner
item.description: Toddler Conor Rees was finishing a meal of fries, chicken nuggets and beans at home in Dublin, Ireland when he was struck by a bout of tiredness.

item.title: Specsavers eye doctor, 50, is suspended 22 YEARS after being arrested for streaking with friends
item.description: Optometrist Jagdip Dhariwal, 50, from Romsey, Hampshire, failed to tell the optical regulation authority about his arrest. He streaked outside his house with friends while he was at university.

item.title: Forged £50 note made by the Nazis to destabilise the British economy during WWII goes up for auction
item.description: The £50 note, bearing the signature of Chief Cashier 'B.S. Catterns', was made as part of Operation Bernhard - a scheme dreamt up by Adolf Hitler to destabilise the economy in Britain.

item.title: Travellers flout social distancing rules as crowds flock to gypsy funeral despite warnings
item.description: Travellers turned out in huge numbers to attend a funeral in Thornaby, North Yorkshire, in defiance of social distancing measures meant to prevent the spread of coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Nations hit hardest had most international travel
item.description: Brazilian researchers found nations hit hardest by the killer disease were ones accepting the most international flights. It may explain why the US (73,431) and UK (30,150) have the most deaths.

item.title: Unruly tourist forces a peacock to pose for a picture with her
item.description: Social media footage from Monday shows the woman pinning down the peacock for a snap as the distressed animal struggles to get away at Yunnan Safari Park in south-eastern China.

item.title: Social worker arrested on suspicion of sexual activity with a child as part of probe into gang
item.description: His arrest follows the launch of Operation Green Jacket last May, an investigation into child exploitation during 2004 and 2005 which included a fresh probe into the abuse Victoria Agoglia aged 15.

item.title: Chinese scenic spot unveils 'the world's largest swing' which stands 30 storeys tall
item.description: A Chinese scenic spot has built a huge swing on the edge of a 2,300-foot-tall cliff and is planning to apply for the world record of the largest swing. The swing is roughly the height of a 30-storey building.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Lockdown is perfect time to lose weight
item.description: Professor Susan Jebb, of Oxford University, urged Brits to stop buying junk food and only have healthy food in their house, and told them to exercise to avoid the temptation of the biscuit tin.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Thousands queue for hours at Birmingham dumps
item.description: Drivers queued for hours outside rubbish dumps in Birmingham today after the waste contractor Veolia opened four of its five waste sites in the city for the first time in seven weeks.

item.title: Illegal migrant 'rapes Italian coronavirus nurse, 48'
item.description: The migrant from Senegal was arrested on Sunday for allegedly raping the 48-year-old after she left work at a Naples hospital at around 3pm. It happened at the Corso Arnaldo Lucci Metropark bus stop.

item.title: How chlorinated chicken STILL has bacteria on it
item.description: Dr Callum Highmore, a Research Fellow in Microbiology at Southampton University told Channel 5's Secrets of Your Supermarket Shop of the dangers of chlorinated chicken.

item.title: Coronavirus: International media asks how UK failed so badly
item.description: The world's media has lined up to savage Britain's coronavirus response this week after the UK's death toll surpassed Italy's to become the worst in Europe.

item.title: How having a happy-sound street name can increase your home's value by nearly £25,000
item.description: Properties with adjectives like 'chipper' and 'gay' in the address are wroth more then those on neighbouring roads, according to data from British financial advice website Bankrate.

item.title: Europe's invasive warty comb jellyfish eats its own offspring
item.description: The cannibalistic animal in question is a species called Mnemiopsis leidyi, which is also known as the warty comb jelly. It regularly washes up on Baltic shores.

item.title: Warburtons unveils its secret crumpet recipe so you can recreate the baked treat at home
item.description: Warburtons has unveiled the recipe for its popular crumpets, and all you need is plain flour, salt, sugar, baking powder and dried yeast - as well as a metal biscuit cutter, reports Metro.

item.title: Bad Company singer Brian Anthony Howe dead at 66 due to cardiac arrest
item.description: TMZ reported on Tuesday morning that the talented musician passed away at his home in Florida while possibly on his way to the hospital according to a relative.

item.title: Being obese may DOUBLE the risk of needing hospital treatment for the life-threatening coronavirus
item.description: Scientists in Glasgow trawled over data for more than 428,000 people who were part of the UK Biobank. Some 340 of those had recently tested positive for COVID-19 in hospital.

item.title: Mosquitoes that can carry diseases could be common in Europe by 2030
item.description: The insect, known by the scientific name Aedes aegypti as well as the common name 'yellow fever mosquito', currently only thrives in the world's hottest regions.

item.title: Dogs destined to be EATEN in South Korea are saved following months spent in cages
item.description: An animal charity mission to save around 70 dogs from the meat farm in Hongseong finally got underway after Humane Society International worked with the farmer.

item.title: North Korea is 'constructing giant storage area for its nuclear missiles'
item.description: North Korea is nearing completion on a new base near the capital of Pyongyang which could be used to increase and protect the country's stockpile of nuclear weapons, analysts say.
item.media:credit: MAXAR Technologies/ Center for Strategic and International Studies

item.title: Prince Harry's ex-girlfriend Cressida Bonas 'auto-weds' her fiancé Harry Wentworth-Stanley
item.description: Winchester-born actress Cressida Bonas, 30, shared an Instagram post as she and her fiancé Harry Wentworth-Stanley dressed up in bride and groom outfits in front of an Auto-wed machine.

item.title: Newly surfaced video reveals how OPRAH could have gifted baby Archie his birthday books
item.description: The Duke, 35, and Duchess of Sussex, 38, are believed to have received the Duck! Rabbit! storybook for their son Archie as part of a gift from media mogul Oprah Winfrey, 66.

item.title: Flock of vultures swoop in to steal cheetah's kill before lion snatches it from them
item.description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT. The group of vultures inch closer to the cheetah in Kruger National Park, South Africa. They take the kill but a lion steals it from them a few moments later.

item.title: Hunt for 'senseless' graffiti yobs after London war memorial is vandalised with permanent marker
item.description: A member of the public in north-west London spotted the damage on the memorial in Church Road in Hayes on Monday, May 4. Officers are asking anyone who recognises the writing to call in.

item.title: Virgin Media and O2 will merge to create a new £31billion media and telecoms giant
item.description: Virgin Media and O2 will merge to create a new £31billion media and telecoms giant, their parent firms have announced today.

item.title: Bear drops down from a balcony after trying to break through a window
item.description: The incident took place in the town of Calliano, in the northern Italian region of Trentino-Alto Adige Sudtirol and the videos were shared by the town's Mayor Lorenzo Conci.

item.title: Immigration drives up UK population by an 'eye-watering' 361,000
item.description: Despite the increase, Britain's population grew at its slowest rate for 15 years between the middle of 2018 and 2019 due to the lowest number of births for 14 years.

item.title: Hundreds of non-recyclable fiberglass wind turbine blades are pictured piling up in landfill
item.description: The municipal landfill in Casper, Wyoming, is the repository of at least 870 discarded blades, and one of the few locations in the country that accepts the massive fiberglass objects.

item.title: Video shows a professional surfer's daring ride down a storm drain in Hawaii
item.description: Professional surfer Jamie O'Brien posted the stellar video to YouTube in April, showing him and his friends surfing down a storm drain in Hawaii.
